Linda Radebe who has since died saw Peter Sewasi, who is my co-applicant.  They asked me that my car should be used.  Peter was having a red headband like members of the IFP whom we were fighting with.

When we took that person we wanted him to explain the neighbours of Unit F. We wanted him to come and explain as to whether what happened to those people who were kidnapped by hostel dwellers whom he was with at that time.

When I explained to the meeting, because they saw me driving faster inside, we told them that we should take that person to Unit F because we were not protected and we were afraid that the police and soldiers would see us.

Yes, I expected to find him alive, Sir.

As I've already explained, we met at safe places.  I wouldn't be in a position to ask him questions about that because we were not trusting each other because there were people who were collaborating with the police and collecting information.  That is why it was not possible to ask him where he found those ammunitions from.

I never bought those ammunitions after the elections.

No, I'm not saying you bought it, I'm just asking you, you told me that one is still able to buy unlawful ammunition or illegal ammunition, sorry.  Do you know why people would still want to buy ammunition in this country today?
I am not able to account to that question, Sir.
Are you still a member of the ANC?
Do you hold any office in its hierarchy?
I am an ordinary member of the ANC.
And finally, Mr Thulo, did you know that it was illegal for you to possess these bullets at that time?

Thank you.
